verses.text: Who \add is\add* this that cometh from Edom , with dyed garments from Bozrah ? this \add that is\add* glorious in his apparel , travelling in the greatness of his strength ? I that speak in righteousness , mighty to save.\f + \fr 63.1 \ft glorious: Heb. decked\f*
Wherefore \add art thou\add* red in thine apparel , and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat ?

I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people \add there was\add* none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger , and trample them in my fury ; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments , and I will stain all my raiment.
For the day of vengeance \add is\add* in mine heart , and the year of my redeemed is come.
And I looked , and \add there was\add* none to help ; and I wondered that \add there was\add* none to uphold : therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury , it upheld me.
And I will tread down the people in mine anger , and make them drunk in my fury , and I will bring down their strength to the earth. \p

¶ I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add and\add* the praises of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, according to all that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel , which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies , and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
For he said , Surely they \add are\add* my people , children \add that\add* will not lie : so he was their Saviour.
In all their affliction he was afflicted , and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old. \p
¶ But they rebelled , and vexed his holy Spirit : therefore he was turned to be their enemy , \add and\add* he fought against them.

Then he remembered the days of old , Moses , \add and\add* his people , \add saying\add*, Where \add is\add* he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock ? where \add is\add* he that put his holy Spirit within him?\f + \fr 63.11 \ft shepherd: or, shepherds\f*
That led \add them\add* by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm , dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name ?
That led them through the deep , as an horse in the wilderness , \add that\add* they should not stumble ?
As a beast goeth down into the valley , the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* caused him to rest : so didst thou lead thy people , to make thyself a glorious name. \p

¶ Look down from heaven , and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory : where \add is\add* thy zeal and thy strength , the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained ?\f + \fr 63.15 \ft the sounding: or, the multitude\f*

Doubtless thou \add art\add* our father , though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add art\add* our father , our redeemer ; thy name \add is\add* from everlasting.\f + \fr 63.16 \ft our redeemer…: or, our redeemer from everlasting is thy name\f* \p
¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways , \add and\add* hardened our heart from thy fear ? Return for thy servants’ sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.
The people of thy holiness have possessed \add it\add* but a little while : our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.
We are \add thine:\add* thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.\f + \fr 63.19 \ft they…: Heb. thy name was not called upon them\f*
